value.0: A beautiful rug is in the process of being woven on this loom.

The Basics of armorcrafting:

To craft a chain shirt, you must use the hammer, twice with the Tongs then bellows, hammer and tongs again.

To craft chainmail, you must use the bellows twice, then repeat the hammer then tongs.

To craft a breastplate, you must use the bellows, then hammer twice. Then tongs, bellows and tongs again.

To craft splintmail you need to use the tongs, hammer and tongs again.  Then Bellows twice and finally the hammer.

To craft half plate, you need to use the hammer, tongs and hamer.  Then bellows twice and finally the tongs.

To craft full plate, you must use the bellows, tongs then hammer.  Finished with the tongs, hammer and bellows.

A small shield begins with the tongs twice, followed by the hammer and tongs, finished with the bellows.

A large shield begins with the bellows. Then tongs and tongs again.  Use the bellows then two strikes with the hammer.

A tower shield requires the tongs to be used twice followed by a strike with the hammer.  Complete it with the tongs, hammer and tongs.

A basic helmet can be forged with two blasts from the bellows.  Then use the tongs twice. End with the bellows and tongs.

How to craft basic weapons

Bullet:
Use the hammer three times.  Followed by the tongs three times.

Dagger:
Use the tongs and hammer.  Then tongs, hammer twice and tongs again.

Mace:
First hammer, then tongs and hammer again.  Use the tongs twice then bellows.

Sickle:
Hammer then use the bellows.  Hammer twice again, then the tongs and the bellows.

Morningstar:
Hammer and hammer again.  Use the bellows, then finish with the hammer.

Throwing Axes:
Use the hammer then tongs.  Repeat, then use the bellows twice.

Light Hammer:
Use the Hammer, then the bellows twice.  Finish with the tongs hammer and tongs again.

Handaxe:
Start with tongs.  Move on to the hammer, tongs, then bellows twice.  Finish with the hammer.

Kukri:
Use the tongs twice, then the hammer.  Tongs again, hammer and hammer again.

Short Sword:
Start with the tongs moving into two strokes with the hammer.  Then two blasts of the bellows and finish with the tongs.

Battleaxe:
Begin with bellows moving into the hammer and tongs.  Then hammer twice and finish with the tongs.

Longsword:
For this item start with the tongs, then hammer and bellows.  End with the tongs, hammer and tongs again.

Rapier:
Use the hammer twice, then double blows with the bellows.  Complete the job with the hammer and tongs again.

Scimitar:
Hammer and bellows.  Then hammer twice.  Use the bellows and tongs again.

Warhammer:
Begin with the hammer, moving over to the bellows.  Use the tongs three times and end with the hammer.

Your guide to large and advanced weapons:

Greataxe:
Begin with the Bellows twice.  Then twice with the hammer and twice with the tongs.

Greatsword:
To forge this item begin with the bellows and tongs.  Two strikes with the hammer ending with tongs and bellows again.

Halberd:
The halberd begins with the bellows twice.  Then the hammer.  Two more times with the bellows and ends with the tongs.

Scythe:
Use the tongs twice followed by the hammer.  Move on to the tongs, hammer and bellows.

Dire Mace:
Use the bellows and the bellows again. Once done move on to the tongs, then the hammer twice.  Finish with the bellows.

Two Bladed Sword:
Start with the bellows then hammer.  Use the bellows twice again and finish with the tongs.

Kama:
Use the tongs twice. then the bellows.  Move to the hammer twice and then the bellows.

Katana:
The Katana starts with two strikes of the hammer, followed by the bellows twice.  Complete it with the hammer and tongs.

Double Axe:
Begin with the bellows and hammer then repeat.  To finish, change the order and use the hammer and then bellows.

The Basics of woodworking.

Quarterstaff:
Begin with the saw twice.  Then use the lathe.  Use the planer, then the lathe and finally the planer again.

Light Crossbow:
The light crossbow requires two passes of the planer, then saw off one end and then the other.  Finish it with the lathe and the planer again.

Heavy Crossbow:
Start with the saw, then the planer and saw again.  Move on to the planer, pass it through the lathe and saw it again.

Shortbow:
The shortbow starts with the planer, then use the saw twice.  Plane it again then use the lathe and saw.

Longbow:
The longbow starts with two passes of the planer.  Then the saw.  Use the planer again and finish with the lathe.

Club:
The club needs to have two passes of the saw then the planer.  Then twice with the saw again and finish with the lathe.

Dart:
A dart requires the saw and planer.  Then the saw and lathe.  Then finally several cuts with the saw.

Bolt:
The bolt needs to have the saw then the planer and repeat.  Then the saw and lathe.

Arrow:
The arrow requires the planer then the saw followed by two more passes with the planer.  Finally use the lathe and saw again.

To begin crafting you will want to collect resources like iron bars or leather hides.

In the following example you will be walked through the act of creating leather armor.

Once you have some hides, find a leather working station. And use the tools in the appropriate order to create your item. You will always need to use six tools.

In this case:
1. Rack.
2. Rack.
3. Basin.
4. Knife.
5. Knife.
6. Rack.

Once you are done using your tools, there is a chance you will fail and a further chance of losing your resources.  Worry not success gets better with time and level.

If you are extremely successful you will create a mastercraft item which can be further enchanted and enhanced.

Each item has a material cost.  If you have insufficient gold, you will be notified of the amount you require during the attempt.

ENHANCING
You will find in your inventory a box called 'combiner'.  You can place two items in this box to further enhance your items.

If you are an enchanter, you may place a scroll of 'mage' armor in the box with your previously crafted leather armor.  Then, use the item in your inventory called the 'combiner activator' and target the combiner.  

If you have sufficient skill and gold the item will be enhanced to +1.  Repeat the process for +2.

Again, each enchantment has a gold cost. If you have insufficient gold, you will be notified.

If you are not a magic user, there are other combinations that can be placed in the combiner, such as rags and garlic to create healing bandages.  

May you find more resources and combinations during your play.  Or, feel free to experiment and see what you may discover!
